brewery.brewery_description: The Wold Top Brewery is situated high on the Yorkshire Wolds where gently sloping hills give way to the sea. High quality Real Ales are traditionally brewed from Wold grown crops and our own pure chalk filtered water to produce great beer!

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 20 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 5!

beer.beer_description: Scarborough IPA aged in Spirit of Yorkshire whisky casks. Hints of soft citrus fruits and hoppy bitter notes married with the light, creamy, vanilla flavours from the Filey Bay whisky give a beautifully rounded, smooth full bodied taste. Aged in barrel for 8 months.

A strong English style IPA. 
A balanced flavour of hops and malt give this golden beer a fresh and biscuity taste.

user.bio: Warwickshire cricket fan,Bromsgrove Sporting supporter,Rugby League afficianado & beer geek AKA Dudley Dave,Pop-up Dave

beer.beer_description: 2023 version only.

items.badge_description: While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly whats on tap! That's 290 check-ins at venue that is verified.  Try 5 more for Level 59!

Round and round the wheel goes! Which style youll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 60 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 13!

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 205 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 42!

beer.beer_description: A rich dark ale, with an underlying maltiness and a subtle fruit aroma, ideal for keeping the chill of winter at bay. The roasted barley and pale chocolate malt give a deep red hue, the hop combination of Progress, Styrian Goldings and Cascade create bitterness with a soft, spicy yet fruity edge. Try this with Yorkshire Parkin and rich fruit cake.

Priceless Golden Blonde Beer

A blonde continental style beer, a heady mix of predominantly Wold grown barley, wheat and cara malt hopped with Goldings and Styrian Goldings hops give the beer its soft, fruity flavour with a hint of spice. Year on year, one of our best selling bottled beers. Beer and curry..... this is the one!

items.badge_description: Sometimes you need a break from all the hops, fruits, and spices. What better way than with a crisp, smooth Blonde Ale or Golden Ale? Basic but delicious. That's 5 different beers with the style of Blonde Ale or Golden Ale. Try 5 more for Level 2!

beer.beer_description: A rich dark ale, with an underlying maltiness and a subtle fruit aroma, ideal for keeping the chill of winter at bay. The roasted barley and pale chocolate malt give a deep red hue, the hop combination of Progress, Styrian Goldings and Cascade create bitterness with a soft, spicy yet fruity edge. Try this with Yorkshire Parkin and rich fruit cake.

items.badge_description: It's time to give bottle shops some love by adding them as your purchased location. That's 220 check-ins with a purchased location! Tag 5 more to get to Level 45. Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 300 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 61!

beer.beer_description:
A strong English style IPA. 
A balanced flavour of hops and malt give this golden beer a fresh and biscuity taste.

items.badge_description: Get that gluten out of here! Thankfully these days, even if you cant eat gluten, you can still enjoy a refreshing gluten-free brew. That's 5 different Gluten Free beers. Try 5 more for Level 2.

items.checkin_comment: Golden with plenty of carbonation. Tangy, citrusy and dry finish.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 355 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower.

beer.beer_description:
Priceless Golden Blonde Beer

A blonde continental style beer, a heady mix of predominantly Wold grown barley, wheat and cara malt hopped with Goldings and Styrian Goldings hops give the beer its soft, fruity flavour with a hint of spice. Year on year, one of our best selling bottled beers. Beer and curry..... this is the one!

A strong English style IPA. 
A balanced flavour of hops and malt give this golden beer a fresh and biscuity taste.

items.badge_description: It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now its time to drink it! Thats 10 check-ins with a photo.

beer.beer_description: The ultimate catch - a refreshing golden pale ale with a fruity bitterness and refreshing aftertaste. Certainly a beer to help create those "one that got away" stories! Brewed with predominantly Wold grown malts and hopped with the fruity Cascade and Goldings hops. Yorkshire Post Taste Award Winner 2011

A strong English style IPA. 
A balanced flavour of hops and malt give this golden beer a fresh and biscuity taste.

items.badge_description: Enjoying a nice Night Out on the town? Thanks for taking Untappd along.

Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 160 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 33!
It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now its time to drink it! Thats 200 check-ins with a photo.
Travel much? You must be a "brewsetter". That's at least a beer from 15 different countries. Try 5 more for Level 4!

Round and round the wheel goes! Which style youll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 55 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 12!

beer.beer_description:
A strong English style IPA. 
A balanced flavour of hops and malt give this golden beer a fresh and biscuity taste.
Wold Top Marmalade Porter, a complex rich dark porter with a sweet malty base, overtones of bitter orange and hints of coffee and chocolate.

Priceless Golden Blonde Beer

A blonde continental style beer, a heady mix of predominantly Wold grown barley, wheat and cara malt hopped with Goldings and Styrian Goldings hops give the beer its soft, fruity flavour with a hint of spice. Year on year, one of our best selling bottled beers. Beer and curry..... this is the one!
Naturally wheat free real ale

The ultimate catch - a refreshing golden pale ale with a fruity bitterness and refreshing aftertaste. Certainly a beer to help create those "one that got away" stories! Brewed with predominantly Wold grown malts and hopped with the fruity Cascade and Goldings hops. Yorkshire Post Taste Award Winner 2011
A red beer to halt you in your tracks, giving you a warm red glow!

A rich dark ale, with an underlying maltiness and a subtle fruit aroma, ideal for keeping the chill of winter at bay. The roasted barley and pale chocolate malt give a deep red hue, the hop combination of Progress, Styrian Goldings and Cascade create bitterness with a soft, spicy yet fruity edge. Try this with Yorkshire Parkin and rich fruit cake.

Golden Summer is our beer of the month for August. Available in cask and bottles, it is a heady mix of Wold grown barley that is malted just down the road in Bridlington, wheat and Cara malt. It is hopped with Goldings and Styrian hops that give the beer its soft, fruity flavour with just a hint of spice. This is the beer to drink whilst basking in the sun on bank holidays or any days!
Look out for it in your local.

Hello Vlo is a sparkling, crisp ale with an earthy spiciness and honeyed marmalade overtones. Its a completely British beer that is brewed with predominantly Hunmanby Grange grown barley, chalk filtered water from the farms own borehole and UK grown Goldings and First Gold hops.

An amber ale with a gentle bitterness leading to a burst of flavour. Wold Top Brewery was founded in 2003 by arable farmers Tom and Gill mellor. Based high on the Yorkshire Wolds where hills roll down to the North Sea, it is a family business that is run by the third and fourth generation Mellors. MALT: Pale, Amber, Torrefied Wheat.  HOPS: Marynka, Challenger, Pilgrim, Cascade.
House beer for "Old Scalby Mills" pub in Scarborough.

This dry hopped lager is finely crafter with notes of apricots, honey and spices. It uses mainly British ingredients to give a lager with a full taste and subtle aroma. Barm is the frothy yeast from the top of the ferment which is often added into dough to help with raising. A suitable name for a beer born of bread!

Scarborough IPA aged in Spirit of Yorkshire whisky casks. Hints of soft citrus fruits and hoppy bitter notes married with the light, creamy, vanilla flavours from the Filey Bay whisky give a beautifully rounded, smooth full bodied taste. Aged in barrel for 8 months.
Low alcohol pale ale
Barrel Aged dark beer. Aged in Spirit of Yorkshire spirit casks for 11 months. Dark, rich and sweet.
Light golden straw colour. Crisp bitter with citrus finish.
